Vian 6th grade students enjoyed a fishing field trip at Marval Resort on September 27. The field trip was the finale to a nine-weeks long SUPERFISH program created by the Future Fisherman Foundation and newly implemented at Vian Middle School this year with the help and oversight of School Resource Officer Robert Allen. SUPERFISH is similar to the well-known Hooked on Fishing, Not on Drugs program. The program not only teaches the fundamentals of fishing, but also aquatic education and environment stewardship.

Special thanks to Marval Resort for donating all the worms as well as the location for the students to fish and to Vickie Cobb for donating salmon eggs and other fishing lures.

Today was very exhilarating, motivational for our students, & just overall an invigorating day. Shout out to Ms. Linda, our awesome IFLY STEM Educator for the physics lesson. This experience definitely created a stir of interest in engineering careers as well as fostering a love of flying!
The program not only reinforced concepts Mrs. Charlotte Trotter has taught the kids in class, but also exposed them to a hands-on approach to stimulate their interest in physics. Of course the best part was getting to take flight in the wind tunnel while learning about basic concepts like terminal velocity, drag, air resistance, & the laws of motion.

We can't thank the V.I.E. Committee enough for the support & encouragement that we need to expose our students to real world lessons such as today's experience.

We can't say enough about IFLY & how great they were with our kids. Our instructor was highly experienced, kept everyone safe, & was very encouraging to our beginning flyers!
